abandoned.descr: A place abandoned due to monster or bandit attacks. Once the danger is eliminated, it will fill with life once more(lvl 9 Endregas)
A place abandoned due to monster or bandit attacks. Once the danger is eliminated, it will fill with life once more(lvl 5 Bandits)
A place abandoned due to monster or bandit attacks. Once the danger is eliminated, it will fill with life once more(lvl 9 Bandits)
A place abandoned due to monster or bandit attacks. Once the danger is eliminated, it will fill with life once more(lvl 4 Drowners)
A place abandoned due to monster or bandit attacks. Once the danger is eliminated, it will fill with life once more(lvl 9 Drowners)
A place abandoned due to monster or bandit attacks. Once the danger is eliminated, it will fill with life once more(lvl 9 Ghouls and lvl 11 Alghoul)

alchemy.descr: Here you can buy alchemy ingredients, also pays well trophies

armourer.title: Amateur Armorer
armourer.descr: Here you can craft armor, repair damaged equipment, dismantle equipment for parts or remove upgrades from sockets. Needs to be saved from: Peet's Landing

armourer.title: Master Armorer (Yoana)
armourer.descr: Is available after the "Master Armorers" (lvl 26) quest. Here you can craft armor, repair damaged equipment, dismantle equipment for parts or remove upgrades from sockets.

banditcamp.descr: A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 9)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 10)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 9)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 9)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 7-9)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 9)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 9)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 9)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 7)
A group of dangerous bandits have made camp here. (lvl 9)

barber.descr: Visit barbers for a shave or a new haircut. Cuts Hair for free! Needs to be saved

blacksmith.title: Journeyman Blacksmith
blacksmith.descr: This blacksmith is available immediately. Here you can craft weapons, repair damaged equipment, dismantle equipment for parts or remove upgrades from sockets.

blacksmith.title: Master Blacksmith* (Hattori)
blacksmith.descr: You must complete "Of Swords and Dumplings" (lvl 24) quest in order to unlock this blacksmith. Here you can craft weapons, repair damaged equipment, dismantle equipment for parts or remove upgrades from sockets.

blacksmith.title: Journeyman Blacksmith
blacksmith.descr: This blacksmith is available immediately. Here you can craft weapons, repair damaged equipment, dismantle equipment for parts or remove upgrades from sockets.

blacksmith.title: Amateur Blacksmith
blacksmith.descr: This blacksmith is available immediately. Here you can craft weapons, repair damaged equipment, dismantle equipment for parts or remove upgrades from sockets.

fasttravel.title: Frischlow
fasttravel.descr: Like many other settlements in the area, this one has suffered greatly on account of the war. Its inhabitants have abandoned their property and evacuated lands in which they once dwelled in relative peace

fasttravel.title: Olena's Grove
fasttravel.descr: Legends claim that a beautiful nymph named Olena once lived in this grove. She fell in love with a young hunter and the man swore to be true to the nymph, but later betrayed her. She decided to punish him by casting a spell on his spirit, which wanders the grove to this day

fasttravel.title: Road to Bald Mountain
fasttravel.descr: The peasants of Velen believe the summit of Bald Mountain is home to witches, werebbubbs and wights

fasttravel.title: The Orphans of Crookback Bog
fasttravel.descr: Orphaned and unwanted children from nearby villages find a roof over their head and a bowl of warm food here

fasttravel.title: Ruined Tower
fasttravel.descr: Five centuries ago King Geddes sent his most loyal knight, Martin of Oakdale, to watch over the inhabitants of this troubled land. He also sent his least-loyal knight, to scrub Martin's latrines

fasttravel.title: Ancient Oak
fasttravel.descr: Centuries ago bloody rituals in honor of the old gods were conducted here. Locals believe dark forces still haunt this place

fasttravel.title: Destroyed Bastion
fasttravel.descr: Bastion built during the reign of King Gardic and destroyed during the First Nilfgaardian War

fasttravel.title: Crossroads
fasttravel.descr: A small crossroads, well trodden by the inhabitants of the surrounding villages

fasttravel.title: Kimbolt Way
fasttravel.descr: Road built on orders of Baron Kimbolt, meant to act as a safe escape route in case his plans to take power after King Foltest's death went awry

fasttravel.title: House of Respite
fasttravel.descr: The House of Respite's motto: "A soldier does not live on war alone." This is slightly misleading, however, for the club is not open to all soldiers, only Nilfgaardian officers (or those capable of passing themselves off as such)

fasttravel.title: Nilfgaardian Army Group 'Center' Camp
fasttravel.descr: Pitched in a mere two weeks, the Army Group 'Center' camp constitutes the quintessence of Nilfgaardian martial architecture

fasttravel.title: Benek
fasttravel.descr: This small village owes its name to its founding elder, who erected the largest windmill the land had ever seen on this spot - thereby providing work for all the village's inhabitants

fasttravel.title: Grotto
fasttravel.descr: A dark and hostile place which creaks from time to time with unsettling, throaty noises...

fasttravel.title: Marauders' Bridge
fasttravel.descr: After the Battle of Velen, marauders swarmed over this bridge in their rush to scavenge the battlefield

fasttravel.title: Toderas
fasttravel.descr: Village founded by King Griffin of Temeria, the husband of Clarissa of Toussaint. The king had planned to turn Toderas into a large, bustling university city, a sort of Temerian alternative to Oxenfurt, but, as any visitor can quickly attest, his efforts failed utterly

fasttravel.title: Reardon Manor
fasttravel.descr: Abandoned estate of the once prominent Reardon family, relatives to the royal La Louve dynasty

fasttravel.title: Downwarren
fasttravel.descr: Before the war, the inhabitants of this village were known for their intricate lacemaking and artisanal smithery

fasttravel.title: Dragonslayer's Grotto
fasttravel.descr: Underneath this fortress lies a musty, rank cave in which a lost traveler will find nothing but a few fattened leeches - if he's lucky. Nevertheless, village elders insist on repeating the legend that gave the grotto its name: that of a legendary dragonslayer said to be buried somewhere deep inside

fasttravel.title: Lurtch
fasttravel.descr: Once the Evves family estate was located here and the area bore the name of Lord Evves' wife, Mortilanca. When the couple died, their will stipulated their land be turned over to their serfs. The grateful peasants then founded a village of freeholders and named it after their first ealdorman, Lurtch, who had previously served as the Evves family's butler

fasttravel.title: Lindenvale
fasttravel.descr: One of Velen's many impoverished villages, its poverty deepened by war levies and the epidemic that spread after the Nilfgaardians' arrival

fasttravel.title: Fyke Isle
fasttravel.descr: Ruined tower which is said to be afflicted by a terrible curse

fasttravel.title: Byways
fasttravel.descr: Most of this area's residents have fled north or died of plague. In better times they busied themselves making prize-winning bricks

fasttravel.title: Duen Hen
fasttravel.descr: Religious site where the old gods are worshipped

fasttravel.title: Condyle
fasttravel.descr: This village has been completely and utterly destroyed. Rumors claim its inhabitants perished in a gruesome massacre

fasttravel.title: Midcopse
fasttravel.descr: Typical farming settlement which the worst of the fighting has left untouched - but which famine now grips all the same. One of the larger villages in this region

fasttravel.title: Refugees' Camp
fasttravel.descr: The members of this small community have erected a large, winged statue - evidence of people turning to old gods and ancient cults in this time of war and famine

fasttravel.title: Forest Hut
fasttravel.descr: Though his friends advised against building a house in the middle of the woods, Hans refused to listen and did things his way. When the war broke out and laid waste to this region, Hans and his family lived in peace, untouched by the troubles of the wider world - until one fateful night...

fasttravel.title: Coast of Wrecks
fasttravel.descr: Once the local youth would come here to revel amidst the wrecks. Now inhabitants of nearby villages have started combing the place day and night in search of anything that can be exchanged for food

fasttravel.title: Hangman's Alley
fasttravel.descr: The road is lined with the hanged bodies of peasants who opposed their new rulers or had the bad luck of happening across bandits who had nothing against adding another dangling installation to the boulevard's scenery

fasttravel.title: Blackbough
fasttravel.descr: This village takes its name from the unwanted limbs loggers used to bring here to burn, leaving stacks of charred logs behind. The locals, however, prefer the old legend which holds that their village was founded by a prominent member of an ancient race of tree people

fasttravel.title: Isolated Shack
fasttravel.descr: Small hut constructed by a famous sculptor who, having garnered every laurel possible for his trade, abandoned his Koviri residence and moved here in order to find inspiration in solitude and reflect on what to make of the rest of his life

fasttravel.title: Harpy Feeding Ground
fasttravel.descr: One of those places entered by only the very brave, or very foolish

fasttravel.title: Lornruk
fasttravel.descr: Years ago smugglers would come here to load and unload illicit cargo

fasttravel.title: Abandoned Tower
fasttravel.descr: Legend has it a beleaguered traveler once stood at this tower's gates. He begged for shelter for the night, claiming he'd been injured, but the baron living inside was afraid the traveler was a spy and sent him away. Little did he know the traveler was a powerful mage, who cast a curse on the tower, its inhospitable owner and all who dwelled with him. Soon thereafter the baron and all his retinue died in mysterious circumstances, and the tower fell into ruin

fasttravel.title: Heatherton
fasttravel.descr: The inhabitants of this village were relieved when they learned the path of the marching armies had shifted slightly and passed their village bye. Then, one night... they changed their mind

fasttravel.title: Wolven Glade
fasttravel.descr: A long, long time ago, when this land was ruled by forest spirits and ancient gods, the living would come here to pay their respects to the dead in the way their holy tome comanded: "Walk thee in darkness, on a path of blood, standing under bare sky, naked before the gods and their messengers."

fasttravel.title: Troll Bridge
fasttravel.descr: Local legend has it this bridge was erected by trolls who were later killed by an anonymous witcher

fasttravel.title: Wastrel Manor
fasttravel.descr: The once-beautiful manor house located near here was known for its extravagant balls, which were attended by the cream of the local youth. Its owners abandoned it over a century ago, but soon afterwards it became a place of worship for the local community, which believes a deity dwells in the ruins

fasttravel.title: Oreton
fasttravel.descr: Village founded by Count Primislavus don Stessa, distant cousin to King Foltest of Temeria. The count was known for his passion for racing chariots down winding forest paths and narrow country roads. This spectacle delighted onlookers, won the hearts of the highborn ladies and aroused hatred in his rivals

fasttravel.title: Claywich
fasttravel.descr: Every year at Belleteyn, a great feast is held in Claywich accompanied by games, song and dance. On that night villagers from far and wide come to celebrate, with passing travelers welcome as well. Shortly before midnight the youth in attendance race deep into the forest in search of a fern flower, and though no one has as yet found one, many have found their other halves, or at least a night of moonlight passion

fasttravel.title: Hanged Man's Tree
fasttravel.descr: During the war, both sides committed acts of exorbitant cruelty meant to keep the conquered populaces in check

fasttravel.title: Mulbrydale
fasttravel.descr: One of the oldest villages in the region. Owes its name to a certain undereducated botanist who could not discern one kind of tree from another and so called them all mulberries

fasttravel.title: Devil's Pit
fasttravel.descr: The inhabitants of Velen believe the expanse of caverns underneath the Devil's Pit are home to demons

fasttravel.title: Stonecutters' Settlement
fasttravel.descr: Over Twenty years ago a certain Bartolomeo, known as "Badger" on account of certain characteristic aspects of his coiffure, discovered a rich deposit of high-quality stone on this spot. He bought the land for a song, then leased it back to local peasants before heading off to Kovir, where he lives the life of a rich and powerful townsman to this day

fasttravel.title: Codgers' Quarry
fasttravel.descr: The now-inactive quarry once only employed stonebreakers over thirty years of age who would work hard all day, then spend the evenings racing down the sides of the quarry pit on hand-crafted wagons

fasttravel.title: Hindhold
fasttravel.descr: This watchtower used to protect barges traveling between Oxenfurt and Novigrad. It once even boasted a bridge connecting the two sides of the river, but now it stands abandoned and neglected, its bridge a collapsed ruin

fasttravel.title: White Eagle Fort
fasttravel.descr: The grand name might seem in ill-fitting with this place, but the troll that lives here - a Redanian patriot and military aficionado - goes to great lengths to make his beloved King Radovid proud

fasttravel.title: Ferry Station
fasttravel.descr: The ferry's former owners were famed for treating travelers who were forced to wait for better conditions to raucous and unforgettable evenings

fasttravel.title: Western Gate
fasttravel.descr: Before war broke out, several hundred people a day would pass through here. Now the Redanian blockade has slowed traffic to a mere trickle

fasttravel.title: Oxenfurt Harbor
fasttravel.descr: Oxenfurt's picturesque port has featured as the subject of numerous odes and ballads, the setting for at least three lurid crime novels, and a favorite spot for romantic outings for generations of students

fasttravel.title: Novigrad Gate
fasttravel.descr: During Oxenfurt Academy's exam sessions, this gate would be closed, to spare the students from Novigrad's temptations

fasttravel.title: Crossroads
fasttravel.descr: A small crossroads in the woods

fasttravel.title: Aeramas' Abandoned Manor
fasttravel.descr: Peasants living nearby often complain about the overwhelming cheese stench wafting out of this residence...

fasttravel.title: Herbalist's Hut
fasttravel.descr: Home to a halfling herbalist who is a passionate devotee of innovative gardening methods and experimental herbal medicine

fasttravel.title: Gustfields Farm
fasttravel.descr: Farmstead founded years ago by an eccentric flaxen-haired painter named Cunigund de Cabbrae, who came here seeking peace, quiet and fresh country air

fasttravel.title: Temerian Partisan Hideout
fasttravel.descr: Though the Nilfgaardians thought Temeria died along with King Foltest, Temerian guerillas still hide in the woods, prepared to give their lives at a moment's notice in their fight for independence

fasttravel.title: Est Tayiar
fasttravel.descr: Long before men first peopled these lands, a beautiful, prospering elven city stood here, centered around the palace of King Maeglor. One day, however, the city's inhabitants began mysteriously dying off in large numbers. According to legend, King Maeglor sensed he, too, would soon perish and cast a powerful spell that caused the earth to swallow the city whole so that no outsider could ever desecrate it. Centuries later, scholars from the Oxenfurt Academy began painstaking excavations of King Maeglor's palace in a search for the causes of the catastrophe. Yet work came to a sudden halt when three subsequent expeditions ventured into the ruins' depths - and were never heard from again...

fasttravel.title: Vegelbud Residence
fasttravel.descr: Domicile of a prominent Novigrad family whose line can be traced back to the times when the first human settlers came to these lands

fasttravel.title: Carsten
fasttravel.descr: A village named after a baker whose exquisite goods gained him fame, as well as the privilege of supplying bread to the table of the hierarch of the Church of the Eternal Fire in Novigrad. Following his death, none proved capable of recreating his recipes for his delicious and depply aromatic breads, so these days Carsten is known chiefly for its trade in grain and flour

fasttravel.title: Wheat Fields
fasttravel.descr: The fertile soils of the Pontar delta guarantee the inhabitants of Novigrad full granaries and full stomaches all year long

fasttravel.title: Alness
fasttravel.descr: Until recently, this was a thoroughly unremarkable village. then the Vegelbuds began organizing their famous horse races here, granting Alness the enviable honor of hosting the region's most pretigious equestrian contests

fasttravel.title: Dancing Windmill
fasttravel.descr: When the current owner's grandfather, the famous dancer Pablo "Sugar" Sasko, ended his career, he settled here and organised nights of dancing for the nearby peasantry. Supposedly these revelries became so fashionable that dung-booted peasants were dancing rounds with members of Novigrad's most elite familes and adventure-seeking urban dandies

fasttravel.title: Honeyfill Meadworks
fasttravel.descr: The renowned Honeyfill Meadworks has for generations belonged to a respected family of halflings

fasttravel.title: Martin Feuille's Farmstead
fasttravel.descr: Founded by Lord Martin Feuille, this vast plantation was until not so long ago the largest producer of alfalfa in the region. Sadly, when war broke out the lord fled to his winter residence in Kovir, leaving his land to be administered by an ill-suited stward who squandered his liege's fertile fields

fasttravel.title: Winespring Grange
fasttravel.descr: Years ago, an eccentric count named Jacobus Ruth of the Rieslings settled here. The count could not stand the pomposity of court life but loved good wine. He thus planted a vineyard here which produces a fabulous beaujolais prized on both sides of the Pontar

fasttravel.title: Moldavie Residence
fasttravel.descr: Despite its ideal location and beautiful surroundings, this residence has been tossed from owner to owner like a hot potato, and for some unknown reason suffers from a bad reputation

fasttravel.title: Isolated Hut
fasttravel.descr: Rumors claim a famous painter lives in this house, though no one has ever seen him or knows his name

fasttravel.title: Yantra
fasttravel.descr: The inhabitants of this village are known for their talkativeness and tendency to exagerrate, which makes them good companions for a round of drink, but impossible to tolerate for long stretches of time

fasttravel.title: Sarrasin Grange
fasttravel.descr: Lord Antares Sarrasin moved his wife and smattering of comely daughters here from far-off Nazair on his medic's recommendations. The leech proclaimed with absolute certainy that "if you wish to sire a son, it must be in the Gustfields." While waiting to produce a male heir, the Sarrasins took to wine cultivation and soon their grange became renowned from Nazair to Skellige

fasttravel.title: Cavern
fasttravel.descr: One of those places wise men avoid at all costs, so as not to tempt fate

fasttravel.title: Oxenfurt Gate
fasttravel.descr: In the times when Novigrad and Oxenfurt were embroiled in fierce neighborly disputes, this gate went through several completely different names, the Gate of Harlots and the Gate of Bloodsuckers being two of the longer lived examples. Its current name was chosen when this conflict was finally put to rest

fasttravel.title: Arette
fasttravel.descr: Novigrad has always attracted those in search of a better life. Some of them found no welcome within the city walls, and so built huts outside the city

fasttravel.title: Seven Cats Inn
fasttravel.descr: This dank establishment is host to a shady clientele

fasttravel.title: Eternal Fire Chapel
fasttravel.descr: This shrine greets travelers on their way to Oxenfurt. Merchants sometimes stop here to sell goods to pilgrims and visiting scholars

fasttravel.title: Cunny of the Goose
fasttravel.descr: This inn owes its name to its former owner, a swaggering, blustering fellow who wanted to attract those of a similar temperatment. Luckily he died of liver poisoning after a few years and ownership passed to a distant relative, who turned the Cunny of the Goose into the best spot for stuffed goose liver in all the region

fasttravel.title: Ursten
fasttravel.descr: War has caused countless refugees to flee Temeria. With the Pontar blockaded, they have tended to flood villages which, like Ursten, are located close to river crossings

fasttravel.title: Drahim Castle
fasttravel.descr: In its glory years, this castle was home to the Redanian Moskovitz of the Sea Cats dynasty, patrons of the arts and admirers of elven culture. After the death by suicide of the dynasty's last member, Prince Adrien, the castle fell into the hands of the Redanian crown - and then into ruin

fasttravel.title: Widows' Grotto
fasttravel.descr: According to legend, many years ago a young woman would wait here and watch for her husband's return from an overseas raid. Years passed and the woman grew old, still waiting for her husband. Yet he never came, and finally, she died. Three days after her funeral, her husband returned, having at last escaped from the pirates who had held him captive all that time. When he learned about his beloved's loyal vigil, he wept bitter tears, then lept to his death

fasttravel.title: Lucian's Windmill
fasttravel.descr: Lucian le Foix, the famous Oxenfurt sculptor and architect, bought this windmill several years ago and made it into his country retreat. Sadly the enormous popularity of the great Lucian's designs means he spends little time in his fortress of solitude and has entrusted its care to a steward

fasttravel.title: Lighthouse
fasttravel.descr: Many years ago a horrible accident took place here: a ship carrying the cousin of King Radovid IV the Bald wrecked against the rocks during a storm. The king ordered a lighthouse erected on that spot in order to warn other seafarers of its deadly danger

fasttravel.title: Loggers Hut
fasttravel.descr: A lone cabin deep in the Novigrad Forest - an ideal base for woodcutters

fasttravel.title: Portside Gate
fasttravel.descr: Though not the most stately of gates, this one's location near the bustling port has made it the calling card of the city

fasttravel.title: Glory Gate
fasttravel.descr: Toughs and hooligans often end a night of drunken escapades under this gate after being thrown out of the nearby taverns

fasttravel.title: Gate of the Hierarch
fasttravel.descr: This gate is named in honor of Novigrad's own son, the Hierach of the eternal Fire. Supposedly this name was given to it upon popular request, though no one can be found who remembers requesting any such thing

fasttravel.title: Tretogor Gate
fasttravel.descr: Gate erected with funds from the Redanian royal family, who, wanting to earn favor with Novigrad merchants and the hierach, dedicated a significant amount of coin to its construction, as well as some no-less-valuable (wo)manpower in the form of the master architect Countess Anna Yaye-Pinkovitz and her skilled crew

fasttravel.title: Southern Gate
fasttravel.descr: In truth demarcating the eastern and not southern edge of the city, the Southern Gate was given its inappropriate name by a one-time city planner who knew nothing about architecture and could not read a map, but had in his favor the fact that he was the mayor's cousin and thew lavish parties. Though confusingly incorrect, the name stuck and now the city's residents never think twice about its illogical appellation

fasttravel.title: Novigrad Docks
fasttravel.descr: A den of dirt and depravity and the shadiest part of Novigrad. After dark all one finds here are women of loose morals, hoodlums and drunk sailors

fasttravel.title: Hierarch Square
fasttravel.descr: Until quite recently a great many mages lived near Novigrad's main square. They fled when the witch hunters began their reign of terror, leaving many of the city's most beautiful townhouses abandoned and uncared for

fasttravel.title: St. Gregory's Bridge
fasttravel.descr: Bridge named after the hero of Novigrad who saved the city from a horrible famine three hundred years ago by sacrificing half his fortune to import food from Nazair. After this, he was declared a saint, something even the jurors of the Church of the Eternal Fire were unable to change

fasttravel.title: Electors' Square
fasttravel.descr: Square named after a group of Novigrad reformers who enacted bold transformations that led to the city's rapid growth, enriching its residents considerably and ushering in the city's golden age

fasttravel.title: Crow's Perch
fasttravel.descr: After Vserad, its previous owner, panicked at the news that armies were approaching and fled to Fyke Isle, this castle became home to Phillip Strenger, alias the Bloody Baron, along with his family and entourage

fasttravel.title: Burned Ruins
fasttravel.descr: One of many structures in the area which did not survive the onslaught of war

fasttravel.title: Boatmakers' Hut
fasttravel.descr: Though nothing about this small domicile is particularly eye-catching, a family of the best shipwrights in Velen has lived here for generations, crafting the finest skiffs and dinghies north of the Yaruga

fasttravel.title: Bandits' Camp
fasttravel.descr: A place some particularly nasty characters have decided to call home

fasttravel.title: Drudge
fasttravel.descr: This once-peaceful fishermen's settlement now stands almost completely empty. Road-weary travelers sometimes find shelter in its abandoned huts - besides that, not a soul is to be seen

fasttravel.title: Inn at the Crossroads
fasttravel.descr: A sizeable establishment able to accommodate a crowd of travelers and revelers

fasttravel.title: Border Post
fasttravel.descr: A small isle stuck in the river's central current - an ideal place for bleaching cloth

gwent.title: Gwent Tournament (Quest)
gwent.descr: Find the scribe and sign up for the high-stakes Gwent tournament

Sells armour and crafting supplies
Sells weapons and crafting supplies

merchant.title: Quartermaster
merchant.descr: Sells nothing note worthy

merchant.title: Wandering Merchant
merchant.descr: Traveling from Lucian's Windmill to the Portside Gate. Sells runestones, alchemy supplies and food
